what_is_this: A curated registry of best-in-class tools for common development tasks. Optimized for AI agents to read and act on. Each entry includes install commands, environment variables, and ready-to-run code.
how_to_use: Find the task you need by id or keywords. Use the 'best' recommendation. Each entry has working code you can execute directly.

tasks.task: Convert audio or video file to text

best.why: 200x faster than running Whisper locally. Processes 1 hour of audio in ~18 seconds instead of 1 hour. ~10x cheaper than OpenAI Whisper API.

code.python:
from groq import Groq

client = Groq()

with open("audio.mp3", "rb") as f:
    result = client.audio.transcriptions.create(
        model="whisper-large-v3-turbo",
        file=f,
        response_format="verbose_json"
    )

print(result.text)

alternatives.why: Most widely documented, reliable accuracy, but slower
Real-time streaming support, great for live audio

tasks.warning: Do NOT use local openai/whisper pip package for production. It processes audio at roughly 1:1 real-time speed on CPU. Always use a cloud API.

tasks.task: Receive and process incoming emails in your application via webhook

best.why: Simple webhook-based inbound email. Configure MX records, set a webhook URL, Resend forwards incoming emails as structured JSON. Same account as send-email.

setup.requires: 1. Domain with MX records pointing to Resend. 2. A webhook endpoint URL.

alternatives.why: More mature, supports complex routing rules and filters

tasks.task: Set up a relational database for a web application

best.why: Full Postgres database with auto-generated REST API, built-in auth, and file storage. Excellent structured documentation that agents can parse easily. Most frequently chosen by AI agents — for good reason.

code.python:
from supabase import create_client
import os

supabase = create_client(os.environ['SUPABASE_URL'], os.environ['SUPABASE_ANON_KEY'])

# Insert
supabase.table('users').insert({'name': 'Alice', 'email': 'alice@example.com'}).execute()

# Query
result = supabase.table('users').select('*').eq('name', 'Alice').execute()
print(result.data)

best.pricing: Free: 500MB database, 2 projects. Pro: $25/mo per project.

alternatives.why: Serverless Postgres that scales to zero. Great for side projects with intermittent traffic. Generous free tier.
SQLite-based, edge-first. Very fast reads. Good if you want embedded database semantics with cloud sync.

tasks.task: Store and serve files (images, documents, videos) from your application

best.why: S3-compatible API (use any existing S3 SDK). Zero egress fees — you never pay for downloads. Includes global CDN. Much cheaper than AWS S3 for read-heavy workloads.

setup.get_api_key: https://dash.cloudflare.com → R2 → Manage R2 API Tokens

code.python:
import boto3
import os

s3 = boto3.client('s3',
    endpoint_url=f'https://{os.environ["R2_ACCOUNT_ID"]}.r2.cloudflarestorage.com',
    aws_access_key_id=os.environ['R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID'],
    aws_secret_access_key=os.environ['R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY']
)

# Upload
s3.upload_file('local_file.png', 'my-bucket', 'uploads/file.png')

# Generate download URL
url = s3.generate_presigned_url('get_object',
    Params={'Bucket': 'my-bucket', 'Key': 'uploads/file.png'},
    ExpiresIn=3600
)
print(url)

best.pricing: Free: 10GB storage, 10M Class B reads/mo, 1M Class A writes/mo. No egress fees.

alternatives.why: Good choice if already using Supabase for database. Integrated auth and policies.
Industry standard, most documented, broadest ecosystem. But has egress fees.

tasks.task: Fetch and extract clean content from web pages

best.why: Returns clean markdown — perfect for LLM and agent consumption. Handles JavaScript-rendered pages. Simple REST API. No browser setup required.

alternatives.why: Free, no API key needed. Just prefix any URL with r.jina.ai/ to get markdown.
Full browser automation, free and open source. More setup required but maximum control.
